content: irish mesh cowl jo strong materials koigu kpm 2 skeins or any fingering weight approximately 220 yards needle 32 circular # 7us 4 5 mm 1 stitch marker size 5 3/4 + 48 after blocking gauge 24 stitches = 4 in stockinette stitch on us 7 change needle size if necessary to obtain gauge i m a tight knitter so don t be alarmed if your gauge is too large on us 7 needles pattern co 220 stitches using long tail cast on place marker join to knit in the round being careful not to twist stitches row 1 - 5 seed stitch row 6 yo sl1 k2tog k1 psso *yo sl1 k2 psso* 219 stitches row 7 knit around row 8 k2 *sl1 k2 psso yo* k1 row 9 knit around row 10 *yo sl1 k2 psso* row 11 knit around row 12 k2 *sl1 k2 psso yo*k1 row 13 knit around row 14 repeat row 10 row 15 - 19 knit around row 20 repeat row 10 row 21 knit around row 22 repeat row 12 row 23 knit around row 24 repeat row 10 row 25 knit around row 26 repeat row 12 row 27 - 31 knit around irish mesh cowl page 2 of 2 pattern con t row 32 repeat row 10 row 33 knit around row 34 repeat row 12 row 35 knit around row 36 repeat row 10 row 37 knit around row 38 repeat row 12 row 39 knit around row 40 repeat row 10 on this row after you have knit the last stitch m1 before sliding stitch marker 220 stitches row 41 - 46 seed stitch bobble loosely in pattern wet block aggressively to make the irish mesh stitch pop abbreviations co = cast on k2tog = knit 2 stitches together m1 = lift running thread between stitch just worked and next stitch from front to back knit into back of this loop psso = pass slipped stitch over 2 knit stitches sl = slip_stitch purlwise yo = yarn over © 2013 jo strong
